children.text: All it took was an 8th grade anatomy class for me to realize I wanted to pursue a career in healthcare. Since then, I’ve dedicated myself to providing patients the individualized care they deserve. My commitment to giving people the support they need in their healthcare journey inspired me to join the Firefly team, providing primary care centered around each patient’s unique needs.

children.text: Good and Bad Cholesterol

It gets a bad rap, but cholesterol isn't always the villain. Your body actually needs cholesterol to survive and perform essential functions, such as building cells and making hormones. But, as is often the case, too much of a good thing can be bad for your health. Because high cholesterol is a major risk factor for heart disease and stroke, we’re breaking down the facts on cholesterol below.

articleRichText.caption: On the chopping block
articleRichText.altText: A person holding a kitchen knife over some chopped vegetables

children.text: What is Cholesterol, anyway?

When it comes to high cholesterol, the best treatment is prevention. Since high cholesterol is often the result of your lifestyle choices, there are ways you can help keep it in check by simply making healthy lifestyle choices.
Two types of Cholesterol
The good kind
The bad kind
Fun Cholesterol Facts
It is often misspelled.
The word
cholesterol
comes from Ancient Greek
chole-
'bile' and
stereos
'solid', followed by the chemical suffix
-ol
for an alcohol.
The best treatment for high cholesterol is prevention. This includes eating healthy foods, moving your body, and managing stress.

children.text: testt
Meet the physicians and nurse practitioners who guide your team and provide your medical care.

I’m from a family of nurses, doctors, and other healthcare providers. My father is a retired anesthesiologist who practiced in Greenfield, MA for over 40 years. His hospital’s community outreach and network of providers impacted me at a young age and I was eager to be a part of a system like his. I chose family medicine because it aligns with one of my strengths — fostering connections with patients. I’m from a family of nurses, doctors, and other healthcare providers. My father is a retired anesthesiologist who practiced in Greenfield, MA for over 40 years. His hospital’s community outreach and network of providers impacted me at a young age and I was eager to be a part of a system like his. I chose family medicine because it aligns with one of my strengths — fostering connections with patients.

All it took was an 8th grade anatomy class for me to realize I wanted to pursue a career in healthcare. Since then, I’ve dedicated myself to providing patients the individualized care they deserve. My commitment to giving people the support they need in their healthcare journey inspired me to join the Firefly team, providing primary care centered around each patient’s unique needs.

I’ve worked in various healthcare settings, including primary and urgent care. After years in conventional medicine, I joined Firefly to help patients navigate the healthcare system and foster a more personal provider-patient relationship. I have a passion for healthcare and continuing education, and I’m an adjunct faculty member at Northeastern University.
I try to really listen to my patients—to understand them as people: what drives them, what they're worried about and what's really going on in their lives.

I have a genuine passion for helping people. In fact, making connections and positively impacting a person’s well-being led me to a career in healthcare. As one of Firefly’s behavioral health specialists, I aim to make healthcare more collaborative and patient-focused. I work closely with my patients to help them feel empowered and healthy.

I always wanted a profession where I could make a real difference helping others. As a registered dietitian nutritionist and certified diabetes care and education specialist, I pair clinical expertise with empathy and active listening to support patients on their health journey. I believe in working together to build healthy, enjoyable habits that patients can stick with over the long haul.

header.title: Meet some of the team behind Firefly

children.text: Change in healthcare demands vision and persistence. Heart and resilience. Our Care Team infuses the Firefly culture with a balance of focused intensity, genuine caring, and earned wisdom.

image.altText: Portraits of members from the Firefly Care Team

children.text: To provide an exceptional member experience, of course we need problem solvers, big thinkers, and specific skill sets. But it’s more than that. Healthcare is intimate, personal, and daunting. That’s why we’re building a team grounded in trust, empathy, and dignity, where anyone and everyone feels safe, welcomed, and included.
